text: (chill music)
- I am Gianluca DeTommaso,

and I am an applied scientist
for AWS working in Berlin.
I started about two years and a half ago

and I started in Amazon,
not in AWS, actually.
The team and my role was like different,
it was a little bit more product oriented.

And about six months
ago now, I joined AWS.

I really like my career
and my role at the moment.

It's very interesting because
we do research pretty much,
and we have a prospective

to have our research
productionized for customers.
So it's cutting-edge science.
I was admired by AWS before joining it.
I think it's got a very good reputation,
at least to my understanding

and I can really confirm
it now that I am inside.
I mean, working here is amazing.
I think I have great colleagues,

I have great environment,
all the opportunities I want
to do research, to productionize.

But I really like innovating
and discovering new things.
So my current role is perfect
because I get to think about a new problem

and try to find a solution
that hasn't been done before.
(chill music continues)
